original: Borthen, Ingrid, skådespelerska, Göteborg, f. i Trondhjem, Norge, av Eyvind Christian B. o. Julie Helène Jeanne Backman. — 8 kl. lärov., Margaretask. i Sthlm 32, stud. v. univ. i Grenoble i Frankr. 32. Res. i Ital. o. Tyskl. f. språkstud. Dramatenelev 36-38, premiärelev 39, eng. v. Dramaten 40-41, spelade bl. a. Karin Månsdotter i Gustav Vasa, Ursula i Som Ni behagar, första större uppgift. på riksteaterturné i Priestleys Tiden o. Vi, senare Rose i Sagan av Hjalmar Bergman, regi Per Lindberg, eng. v. Stadsteatern i Gbg sed. 42, första större uppg. där i Den värld vi själva bygga, Mans kvinna. Sällsamt ärende. Vår ofödde son m. fl. Filmroller i bl. a. Flickan o. djävulen, I som här inträden samt Iris o. löjtnantshjärta. Led. av Sv. teaterförb.
translated: Borthen, Ingrid, actress, Gothenburg, born in Trondheim, Norway, to Eyvind Christian B. and Julie Helène Jeanne Backman. Completed 8 years of schooling, studied at Margareta School in Stockholm in 1932, and at the University of Grenoble in France in 1932. Traveled to Italy and Germany for language studies. Was a drama student from 1936-1938, a premier student in 1939, and an actor at the Royal Dramatic Theatre in 1940-41, where she played roles such as Karin Månsdotter in Gustav Vasa, and Ursula in As You Like It. Her first major role was in Priestley's Time and the Conways on a national theatre tour. Later, she played Rose in Hjalmar Bergman's tale, directed by Per Lindberg, and acted at the Gothenburg City Theatre starting in 1942, where her first major role was in the play We Create Our Own World, Mans Woman. Strange errand. Our unborn son, and others. She also appeared in films such as The Girl and the Devil, You Who Came Here, and Iris and the Lieutenant's Heart. She was a member of the Swedish Theatre Union. She married in 19xx.

performerIn.name: We Create Our Own World, Mans Woman. Strange errand. Our unborn son, and others
